subclusters.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
General Hallmarks of Aging Across Species

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory emphasizes the core molecular damage hallmarks including genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis as fundamental drivers of multisystem deterioration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on primary molecular damage hallmarks such as genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis as key aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cellular Senescence-Centered Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights cellular senescence as a central node interconnected with other hallmarks, emphasizing its role in driving aging and as a target for intervention.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on primary hallmarks including genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis in the context of Alzheimer’s disease.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes primary molecular damage hallmarks such as genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis as drivers of frailty and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Hallmarks of Aging Across Species
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on the hallmarks of aging as generalizable biological features across species, covering fundamental mechanisms driving aging at organismal level.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cellular Senescence-Centered Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes mitochondrial dysfunction, genomic instability, telomere shortening, and cellular senescence, highlighting senescence as a key aging mechanism.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation and Autophagy-Linked Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genomic instability and telomere attrition but also highlights inflammation and autophagy decline as key aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes primary hallmarks including genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis in nutritional and lifestyle context.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Integrated Hallmarks of Aging Framework
theory_assignments.reasoning: Divides hallmarks into primary (molecular damage), antagonistic (compensatory responses), and integrative (phenotypic outcomes), covering a broad mechanistic spectrum.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on primary hallmarks including genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis in premature aging disorders.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights primary molecular damage hallmarks such as genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis in age-related disease co-occurrence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation and Epigenetic Alterations Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on epigenetic alterations, chronic inflammation, dysbiosis, and telomere attrition with emphasis on neurodegenerative disease mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Integrated Hallmarks of Aging Framework
theory_assignments.reasoning: Uses the primary, antagonistic, and integrative hallmarks framework, covering molecular damage, compensatory responses, and phenotypic outcomes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Vascular and Systemic Hallmarks of Mammalian Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes interconnected hallmark processes with a focus on vascular aging as a driver of systemic aging and age-related cardiovascular diseases.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Integrated Hallmarks of Aging Framework
theory_assignments.reasoning: Expands hallmarks to include macroautophagy, chronic inflammation, and dysbiosis, emphasizing interdependence and modifiability of hallmarks.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cellular Senescence-Centered Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Applies hallmarks to dermal fibroblasts, emphasizing cellular senescence, mitochondrial dysfunction, and DNA damage as key aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on primary hallmarks including genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis in myelodysplasia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Cellular Senescence-Centered Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights genomic damage, mitochondrial dysfunction, cellular senescence, and stem cell exhaustion as key aging mechanisms in CNS.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammation and Cellular Senescence Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative stress, inflammaging, cellular senescence, and DNA damage as core aging processes driving multimorbidity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction, telomere biology, epigenetic modifications, and proteostasis decline in lifestyle disease context.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Proteostasis Hallmarks of Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and loss of proteostasis in ischemic stroke and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Hallmarks of Aging Across Species
theory_assignments.reasoning: Provides a structured framework of interconnected hallmarks including genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, and others driving systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Hallmarks of Aging Across Species
theory_assignments.reasoning: Distinguishes public (conserved) and private (species-specific) aging mechanisms, focusing on fundamental hallmarks conserved across organisms.
